Math.title: Counting to 10
Math.question: How many apples are there?
Math.explanation: We count each apple to reach seven.

Math.title: Basic Addition
Math.question: What is 3 + 2?
Math.explanation: Adding three objects and two objects makes five.

Math.title: Basic Subtraction
Math.question: What is 5 − 2?
Math.explanation: If you have five apples and take away two, you have three left.

Math.title: Comparing Numbers
Math.question: Which number is bigger: 4 or 6?
Math.explanation: Six is greater than four.

Math.title: Shapes
Math.question: Which shape has three sides?
Math.explanation: A triangle has three sides; a square has four and a circle has none.

Math.title: One More
Math.question: What number is one more than 8?
Math.explanation: One more than eight is nine.

Math.title: One Less
Math.question: What number is one less than 5?
Math.explanation: One less than five is four.

Math.title: Number Sequencing
Math.question: Which number is smallest?
Math.explanation: One is the smallest number among the options.

Math.title: Odd or Even
Math.question: Is the number 6 odd or even?
Math.explanation: Six can be split into two equal groups, so it is even.

Math.title: Missing Number
Math.question: What number is missing? 3, 4, _, 6
Math.explanation: The sequence counts up by one: 3, 4, 5, 6.

Math.title: Counting Objects
Math.question: How many fingers are on one hand?
Math.explanation: Most people have five fingers on one hand.

Math.title: Compare Numbers
Math.question: Which number is greater: 2 or 9?
Math.explanation: Nine is larger than two.

Math.title: Add Two Numbers
Math.question: What is 1 + 3?
Math.explanation: One plus three equals four.

Math.title: Subtract Two Numbers
Math.question: What is 7 − 1?
Math.explanation: Seven minus one equals six.

Math.title: Pattern Completion
Math.question: What comes next in the pattern: 2, 4, 6, ?
Math.explanation: The pattern counts by twos: 2, 4, 6, 8.

Reading.title: Sight Words
Reading.question: Which word spells 'cat'?
Reading.explanation: The letters c‑a‑t spell 'cat'.

Reading.title: Alphabet Order
Reading.question: Which letter comes first in the alphabet?
Reading.explanation: The alphabet starts with the letter A.

Reading.title: Rhyming Words
Reading.question: Which word rhymes with 'hat'?
Reading.explanation: 'Hat' and 'bat' both end with the 'at' sound.

Reading.title: Sentence Comprehension
Reading.question: What do I like to eat?
Reading.explanation: The sentence says 'I like to eat apples.'

Reading.title: Beginning Sounds
Reading.question: Which word begins with the sound /b/?
Reading.explanation: The /b/ sound starts the word 'ball'.

Reading.title: Alphabet Order
Reading.question: Which letter comes after C?
Reading.explanation: The alphabet goes A, B, C, D, so D comes after C.

Reading.title: Rhyming Words
Reading.question: Which word rhymes with 'dog'?
Reading.explanation: 'Dog' and 'fog' both end with the 'og' sound.

Reading.title: Sight Word Recognition
Reading.question: Which word spells 'the'?
Reading.explanation: The letters t‑h‑e in that order spell 'the'.

Reading.title: Sentence Comprehension
Reading.passage: The dog is big and brown.
Reading.question: What color is the dog?
Reading.explanation: The sentence says the dog is big and brown.

Reading.title: Syllable Counting
Reading.question: How many syllables are in the word 'apple'?
Reading.explanation: Ap‑ple has two syllables.

Reading.title: Onset and Rime
Reading.question: Combine the sounds /h/ and /at/ to make a word.
Reading.explanation: The sounds /h/ + /at/ make the word 'hat'.

Reading.title: Opposite Words
Reading.question: Which word is the opposite of 'up'?
Reading.explanation: The opposite of up is down.

Reading.title: First Letter
Reading.question: What is the first letter of the alphabet?
Reading.explanation: The alphabet begins with the letter A.

Reading.title: Choose the Correct Spelling
Reading.question: Which word spells 'sun'?
Reading.explanation: The letters s‑u‑n spell 'sun'.

Reading.title: Word Meaning
Reading.question: Which word means 'small'?
Reading.explanation: 'Tiny' describes something very small.

Science.title: Seasons
Science.question: Which season is the coldest?
Science.explanation: Winter is cold with snow in many places.

Science.title: Five Senses
Science.question: Which sense do we use to smell?
Science.explanation: We use our nose to smell things.

Science.title: Animal Types
Science.question: Which one is a mammal?
Science.explanation: Dogs are mammals because they have fur and drink milk as babies.

Science.title: Plant Parts
Science.question: What part of a plant takes in water?
Science.explanation: Roots absorb water and nutrients from the soil.

Science.title: Weather
Science.question: What do we use when it rains?
Science.explanation: We use an umbrella to stay dry in the rain.

Science.title: Seasons
Science.question: Which season is hot and sunny?
Science.explanation: Summer is usually hot and sunny.

Science.title: Body Parts
Science.question: Which part of your body do you use to hear?
Science.explanation: We hear with our ears.

Science.title: Animal Identification
Science.question: Which one is a bird?
Science.explanation: A duck is a bird because it has feathers and lays eggs.

Science.title: Plant Leaves
Science.question: What part of a plant makes food using sunlight?
Science.explanation: Leaves use sunlight, water and air to make food for the plant.

Science.title: Day and Night
Science.question: What do we see in the sky at night?
Science.explanation: The moon is visible in the night sky.

Science.title: States of Matter
Science.question: When ice melts, it becomes _____.
Science.explanation: Melting ice changes from solid to liquid water.

Science.title: Healthy Habits
Science.question: What should you do to keep your hands clean?
Science.explanation: Washing your hands removes dirt and germs.

Science.title: Simple Science
Science.question: What falls from the sky when it rains?
Science.explanation: Rain drops fall from clouds when it rains.

Science.title: Earth Materials
Science.question: What can you use to build a sandcastle?
Science.explanation: Sand is used to build sandcastles at the beach.

Science.title: Helping the Earth
Science.question: What should we do with paper instead of throwing it away?
Science.explanation: Recycling paper helps protect natural resources.

Math.title: Multiplication Facts
Math.question: What is 4 x 3?
Math.explanation: Four groups of three equals twelve.

Math.title: Fractions
Math.question: What fraction of the circle is shaded?
Math.explanation: Half of the circle is shaded.

Math.title: Division
Math.question: What is 12 ÷ 4?
Math.explanation: Twelve divided by four equals three.

Math.title: Area of a Rectangle
Math.question: If a rectangle is 4 units long and 3 units wide, what is its area?
Math.explanation: Area equals length times width: 4 × 3 = 12.

Math.title: Place Value
Math.question: What is the value of the 7 in 573?
Math.explanation: The 7 is in the tens place, so its value is seventy.

Math.title: Pattern Sequence
Math.question: What comes next in the pattern: 5, 10, 15, ?
Math.explanation: The pattern increases by 5 each time: 5, 10, 15, 20.

Math.title: Multiplication Facts
Math.question: What is 6 x 7?
Math.explanation: Six groups of seven equals forty‑two.

Math.title: Division Facts
Math.question: What is 20 ÷ 5?
Math.explanation: Twenty divided by five equals four.

Math.title: Equivalent Fractions
Math.question: Which fraction is equivalent to 1/2?
Math.explanation: Two‑fourths reduces to one‑half.

Math.title: Comparing Fractions
Math.question: Which is larger: 3/4 or 2/3?
Math.explanation: Three‑fourths is larger than two‑thirds.

Math.title: Perimeter of a Rectangle
Math.question: A rectangle is 5 units long and 2 units wide. What is its perimeter?
Math.explanation: Perimeter = 2 × (length + width) = 2 × (5 + 2) = 14.

Math.title: Place Value
Math.question: In the number 3,452 what is the value of the 4?
Math.explanation: The digit 4 is in the hundreds place, so it represents four hundred.

Math.title: Money Addition
Math.question: If you have two quarters, one dime and one nickel, how much money do you have?
Math.explanation: Two quarters = 50¢, one dime = 10¢, one nickel = 5¢; total = 65¢.

Math.title: Multiplying by Zero
Math.question: What is 9 × 0?
Math.explanation: Any number multiplied by zero equals zero.

Math.title: Simple Word Problem
Math.question: You have 12 cookies and you share them equally among 4 friends. How many cookies does each friend get?
Math.explanation: Twelve divided by four equals three cookies each.

Reading.title: Reading Comprehension
Reading.passage: The sun warms the earth and helps plants grow.
Reading.question: What does the sun do?
Reading.explanation: The passage says the sun warms the earth.

Reading.title: Vocabulary
Reading.question: What does 'cautious' mean?
Reading.explanation: 'Cautious' means being careful or showing caution.

Reading.title: Main Idea
Reading.passage: Sally's dog ran away and she searched for hours until she found him at the park.
Reading.question: What is the main idea of the story?
Reading.explanation: The story is mainly about Sally losing and finding her dog.

Reading.title: Synonyms
Reading.question: Which word is a synonym for 'happy'?
Reading.explanation: 'Joyful' means the same as 'happy'.

Reading.title: Antonyms
Reading.question: Which word is the opposite of 'cold'?
Reading.explanation: 'Hot' is the antonym, or opposite, of 'cold'.

Reading.title: Context Clues
Reading.passage: The girl glided gracefully across the stage during her ballet performance.
Reading.question: What does 'glided' most nearly mean?
Reading.explanation: In context, 'glided' means moved smoothly and gracefully.

Reading.title: Fact or Opinion
Reading.question: 'Cats are the best pets in the world.' Is this a fact or an opinion?
Reading.explanation: This sentence expresses a personal feeling, not a fact.

Reading.title: Sequence of Events
Reading.passage: In the morning I brush my teeth, then I eat breakfast.
Reading.question: What happens first?
Reading.explanation: The passage states that brushing teeth happens before breakfast.

Reading.title: Synonyms
Reading.question: Which word is a synonym for 'begin'?
Reading.explanation: 'Begin' and 'start' mean the same thing.

Reading.title: Prefixes
Reading.question: What does the prefix 're-' mean in 'rewrite'?
Reading.explanation: The prefix 're-' means again; 'rewrite' means write again.

Reading.title: Suffixes
Reading.question: What does the suffix '-ful' mean in 'joyful'?
Reading.explanation: The suffix '-ful' means 'full of'; 'joyful' means full of joy.

Reading.title: Homophones
Reading.question: Which pair of words are homophones?
Reading.explanation: 'Blue' and 'blew' sound the same but have different meanings and spellings.

Reading.title: Cause and Effect
Reading.passage: It rained all day, so the soccer game was cancelled.
Reading.question: Why was the soccer game cancelled?
Reading.explanation: The cause of the cancellation was the rain.

Reading.title: Main Idea
Reading.passage: Birds build nests in trees to protect their eggs from predators.
Reading.question: What is the main idea of the sentence?
choices: Birds build nests to keep eggs safe
Reading.answer: Birds build nests to keep eggs safe
Reading.explanation: The sentence explains that birds build nests to protect their eggs.

Reading.title: Compound Words
Reading.question: Which of these is a compound word?
Reading.explanation: A compound word is formed from two smaller words; 'sun' + 'flower' = 'sunflower'.

Science.title: States of Matter
Science.question: Water can be a solid, liquid, or what?
Science.explanation: Water becomes water vapor, which is a gas.

Science.title: Solar System
Science.question: Which planet is known as the red planet?
Science.explanation: Mars appears red because of iron oxide on its surface.

Science.title: Life Cycles
Science.question: A butterfly starts as an egg, then becomes a caterpillar, a pupa, and finally a _______.
Science.explanation: After the pupa stage, a butterfly emerges as an adult.

Science.title: Photosynthesis
Science.question: What do plants need to make food?
Science.explanation: Plants use water and sunlight to make food through photosynthesis.

Science.title: Conductors
Science.question: Which material is a conductor of electricity?
Science.explanation: Metals allow electricity to flow through them.

Science.title: Gravity
Science.question: What force pulls objects toward the Earth?
Science.explanation: Gravity pulls objects toward the centre of the Earth.

Science.title: Forms of Energy
Science.question: What kind of energy do we get from the sun?
Science.explanation: The sun provides light energy and also heat energy.

Science.title: Food Chains
Science.question: An animal that eats only plants is called a(n) _____
Science.explanation: Herbivores eat only plants.

Science.title: Weather and Climate
Science.question: What tool is used to measure temperature?
Science.explanation: A thermometer measures how hot or cold it is.

Science.title: Water Cycle
Science.question: When water evaporates from lakes and oceans, it turns into ______.
Science.explanation: Evaporation changes liquid water into water vapour in the air.

Science.title: Mixtures and Solutions
Science.question: What is a mixture of salt and water called?
Science.explanation: Salt dissolved in water forms a solution.

Science.title: Natural Resources
Science.question: Which of these is a renewable resource?
Science.explanation: Sunlight is constantly available and cannot be used up.

Science.title: Force and Motion
Science.question: A push or pull that can change the motion of an object is called a ______.
Science.explanation: A force is any push or pull on an object.

Science.title: Solar System
Science.question: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
Science.explanation: Mercury is the planet closest to the Sun.

Science.title: Life Cycle of a Frog
Science.question: What is the correct order of a frog's life cycle?
Science.explanation: Frogs start as eggs, hatch into tadpoles, and grow into adults.
